meanings.definition: Small pieces of dry dog food.
meanings.sent1: My dog loves to eat kibble every day.
meanings.sent2: The kibble in the bowl is for the hungry puppy.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled kibble all over the kitchen floor!
meanings.sent4: The kibble scattered on the ground like confetti.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh kibble filled the room.

meanings.definition: To grind or crush into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: I need to kibble the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent2: She likes to kibble the ice to make it easier to chew.
meanings.sent3: He tried to kibble the rock with his bare hands!
meanings.sent4: The machine can kibble the wood into sawdust quickly.
meanings.sent5: The chef will kibble the herbs finely for the sauce.

meanings.definition: A small metal loop attached to a fishing rod for holding the line.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carefully adjusted the kibble on his rod.
meanings.sent2: The shiny kibble gleamed in the sunlight by the lake.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the kibble on the rod was a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: The kibble on the fishing rod danced with each tug of the fish.
meanings.sent5: The kibble on the rod clicked softly as he cast his line.
